dict.string: Bookmark emails, files & webpages for easy access

cd "$alfred_workflow_directory"
if [ "$item_type" = "email" ]; then python3 scripts/tag_emails.py "$1" elif [ "$item_type" = "file" ]; then python3 scripts/tag_files.py "$1" elif [ "$item_type" = "webpage" ]; then python3 scripts/tag_tabs.py "$1" else echo "Unknown item_type: $item_type" >&2 exit 1 fi
Run a previously saved search query

cd "$alfred_workflow_directory" python3 scripts/remove_item_from_tag.py "$1"
tag="${1%%||*}" caller="${caller}"
# call the right refresh trigger osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 5\" to run trigger \"refresh_${caller}\" in workflow \"com.toddsgotapen.bookmarkit\" with argument \"$tag\""

cd "$alfred_workflow_directory" python3 scripts/open_item.py "$1"
if [ "$reprompt" = "1" ] && [ -n "$caller" ]; then osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 5\" to run trigger \"refresh_${caller}\" in workflow \"com.toddsgotapen.bookmarkit\" with argument \"$tag\"" fi
Search all items by their key attributes

cd "$alfred_workflow_directory" python3 scripts/rename_tag.py "$1"
osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 5\" to run trigger \"refresh_list_tags\" in workflow \"com.toddsgotapen.bookmarkit\""
Show tagged items grouped by bookmarks

cd "$alfred_workflow_directory" python3 scripts/rename_title.py "$1"
caller="${caller}"
# call the right refresh trigger osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 5\" to run trigger \"refresh_${caller}\" in workflow \"com.toddsgotapen.bookmarkit\" with argument \"$tag\""

cd "$alfred_workflow_directory"
if [ "$1" = "open_workflow" ]; then open "$alfred_workflow_directory"
elif [ "$1" = "open_data" ]; then open "$alfred_workflow_data"
elif [ "$1" = "edit_data" ]; then open "$alfred_workflow_data/items.json"
else python3 scripts/util_${1}.py fi

import json import sys
query = sys.argv[1].lower() if len(sys.argv) > 1 else ""
items = [ {"title": "Open workflow folder", "arg": "open_workflow"}, {"title": "Open data folder", "arg": "open_data"}, {"title": "Backup data file", "arg": "backup_data"}, {"title": "Edit data file", "arg": "edit_data"}, {"title": "Export URLs", "arg": "export_urls"}, #{"title": "Initialize workflow", "arg": "init_workflow"}, #{"title": "Reset workflow (volitile ❗)", "arg": "reset_workflow"} ]
filtered = [item for item in items if query in item["title"].lower()]
print(json.dumps({"items": filtered}))
Tag & search using these supported symbols

# Bookmark It!
Bookmark emails, files & web pages for easy access later on via Alfred. Easily manage your work projects, research, web orders, recipes... whatever.
Works with: `Apple Mail` ∙ `Apple Finder` ∙ `Chrome, Brave, Safari, Arc & Edge Browsers`
▸ Requires [jq](https://formulae.brew.sh/formula/jq)
> *Check out Bookmark It!'s brother workflow, [Restore It!](https://github.com/modrocko/restore-it)*
## Usage
### Main workflows
![tag](assets/tag.png)
### Bookmark It!
To get started... bookmark emails, files, folders or webpages. Keep typing to create a new tag. Or select an existing tag.
![tagi](assets/tagi.png)
<kbd>↵</kbd> Tag all selected emails in Apple Mail window
<kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↵</kbd> Tag all selected files in front-most Finder window
<kbd>⌥</kbd><kbd>↵</kbd> Tag all browser tabs as per preference setting
### List tagged items
From the previous dialog... show all tags containing items for that tag.
![tagl](assets/tagl.png)
<kbd>↵</kbd> View list of item types for this tag (emails, files & tabs)
<kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↵</kbd> Rename this tag
<kbd>⌥</kbd><kbd>↵</kbd> Remove this tag & all its tagged items
<kbd>⌃</kbd><kbd>↵</kbd> View flat list all items for this tag
### List item types
From the previous dialog... show tagged items, grouped by item type.
![tagl2](assets/tagl2.png)
<kbd>↵</kbd> View items for that item type
<kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↵</kbd> Tag more items of that item type
<kbd>⌥</kbd><kbd>↵</kbd> Remove items of that item type
<kbd>⌃</kbd><kbd>↵</kbd> Open all items of that item type
### Search tagged items
Show complete, flat list of all previously tagged items. Start typing to filter the list by title, tag, & more fields.
![tags](assets/tags.png)
By default, all searches are `AND` searches — whatever you type, will show bookmarks that fulfill all of your search criteria. This feature also supports `OR` searches. Just supply `:or`at the end of your query: `bkms @wait @ping :or`
<kbd>↵</kbd> Open the selected item
<kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↵</kbd> Remove the item (untag) from this tag
<kbd>⌥</kbd><kbd>↵</kbd> Rename the item (good for applying a note too)
<kbd>⌃</kbd><kbd>↵</kbd> Save this search to quickly access later
### List saved searches
List any searches saved from the dialog above.
![](assets/bkmss.png)
<kbd>↵</kbd> Run this saved search
<kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↵</kbd> Remove this saved search
### Show recent items
Show a list of the most recently opened items. Start typing to filter the list by title, tag, & more fields.
![tagr](assets/tagr.png)
<kbd>↵</kbd> Open the selected item
### Run a utility command
Some useful commands to do some maintenance or move around this workflow
![tagu](assets/tagu.png)
Choose the command to run.
*Note:* `Reset workflow` *will remove all data to start over.*
---
## Tips
### Domain Icons
Drop any png file into the icons folder for your tagged bookmarks — based on domain urls.
For example, (1) Search the web for the Dropbox logo file (2) Download & name it `dropbox.png` (3) Place it in the `/icons` folder in your `workflow folder`
All `dropbox.com` tagged urls will now display `dropbox.png` as the default icon.
I provided a few starter icons for you. Then build your icon library over time.
### Tag icons
Specify these tags: `@urgent` `@waiting` `@ping` `@notes` — see icons like these for your tags & items:
![](assets/tag-icons.png)
*More icons coming...*
### Supported Symbols
See the latest symbols supported for tagging & searching items. These are great to add to your tags or items. Add more in the `Configure Workflow` section.
![tagsy](assets/tagsy.png)
### More Configurations
Set other useful features in `Configure Workflow`.
![config](assets/config.png)
Select the browser for tagging browser tabs
Select how this workflow should tag browser tabs. Add new symbols or change key for existing ones. Consider keys like this too ':chk'.
Option to be reprompted after opening an item
Set the number of max items to use for viewing recent items
New searches will override older searches after this limit
Bookmark an email file, folder or webpage
Search through a list of all bookamrked items by title, name, type & more
Show items opened recently when using this workflow
Run a previously saved search query
Show utilities command to see data or folders
Show the symbols that can be used to tag & search for tagged items
{ ":!" : "❗ : Important", ":?" : "❓ : Needs clarity", ":x" : "❌ : No-go", ":chk": "✅ : Complete", ":pin": "📌 : Follow-up", ":red": "🔴 : Red", ":grn": "🟢 : Green", ":yel": "🟡 : Yellow" }
Use symbols to tag & search for items. Add new symbols or change keys for existing ones.
